intro: Centaurea splendens, commonly known as the splendour bluemink, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers and silver-gray foliage, which give it a striking appearance in gardens. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Centaurea splendens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in moderate climates.
